717796f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Nagle Avenue
717796f-a.text:
Broadyav (across midground of panoramic wioys ) from Nale

717793f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Bennett Avenue
717793f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, at Bennett Avenue. Between 1934 and 1935,
this section will be made into Fort Tryon Park.
November 23, 1930.
P. L. Sperr.

717797f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Nagle Avenue
717797f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, north from and including Nagle Ave. The
building in the process of construction, is the new Jewish Memorial
Hospital.
November 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.
(2)
A view further northward, showing a closer perspective of the afore-
mentioned hospital, which is located at the 3.E. corner of West 196th
Street.
November 3, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

717794f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Nagle Avenue
717794f-b.text:
Broadway, at Nacle Avenue as viewed eastward in No. 1 and
southward in No. 2 from Fort Trvon Park on the westerly
side of this thoroughfare. Apartrment seen in the foreground
exterd betzeen Broadvav and Bennett Avenue. Note to the right
of No. 1 the hillside where Fort George stood. Intersection
shown in same is Nagle Avenue,forminm an angle with Broadway:
tbe latter extending from right to left.
November 23, 1930.
View 21 April 1', 1936.
P.L. Sperr
